description: A double-mouthed half-covered stop of 8' or 4' pitch, essentially a cross between the Doppelflöte and the Rohrflöte. It is most commonly made of wood. When made of metal, Audsley recommends a one-fifth mouth, arched upper lip, and a wooden stopper perforated with a vertical hole. The 8' octave is often of stopped pipes with single mouths.
